title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 141-2.5 - Payments in addition to regular wages
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 141-2.5 - Payments in addition to regular wages

State Regulations
(a) Payments in addition to regular wages may
be considered part of the minimum wage, provided they are: (1)
for work generally performed by
janitors; (2)
recorded in the
payroll book; and
(3)
credited only
for the payroll period during which payment was made. (b) Payments for painting an apartment or for
major repairs may not be considered as part of the minimum wage. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
141-2.5

Amended

New

York State Register December 28, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 52, eff. 12/31/2016

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
